meanings.definition: To wash clothes or linens again.
meanings.sent1: After the rain, I had to relaunder my clothes to get rid of the mud stains.
meanings.sent2: She decided to relaunder the bedsheets to make sure they were extra clean.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally spilled juice on my freshly washed shirt, so I had to relaunder it.
meanings.sent4: The river water was so dirty that it seemed like it could relaunder anything thrown into it.
meanings.sent5: The washing machine broke down, forcing me to relaunder everything by hand.

meanings.definition: To process money obtained illegally to make it appear legitimate.
meanings.sent1: The criminals tried to relaunder the stolen money through various businesses.
meanings.sent2: The investigation revealed a complex scheme to relaunder the illicit funds.
meanings.sent3: The movie plot involved a group of thieves trying to relaunder their loot.
meanings.sent4: The accountant was caught attempting to relaunder company funds for personal gain.
meanings.sent5: The bank implemented strict measures to prevent customers from trying to relaunder money.

meanings.sent1: The authorities arrested the notorious relaunder who had been operating in the city.
meanings.sent2: The relaunder's identity was finally uncovered after months of investigation.
meanings.sent3: In the crime novel, the relaunder turned out to be the least suspected character.
meanings.sent4: The relaunder's lavish lifestyle raised suspicions among the neighbors.
meanings.sent5: The undercover agent posed as a potential client to gather evidence against the relaunder.
